Workforce development hub for immigrants and working-class families, offering job hunting skill training, resume feedback, worker rights workshop and legal aid. It connects clients to resources for their economic stability.
properties.Hours: Monday - Friday 9 a.m. - 5 p.m. Closed for lunch 12 - 1 p.m.

properties.Item: Bernal Heights Neighborhood Center - Excelsior Community Center
properties.About: Nonprofit community-service agency offering food pantry, employment and senior programing.

properties.Item: Self Help for the Elderly - Geneva Community Center
properties.Address: 5050 Mission Street, Suite C, San Francisco, CA 94112
properties.About: Daily recreational and educational activities, nutritious meals, health education, and vital social services like case management, advocacy, and in-home support for seniors.

Free, multilingual early childhood and family support services for low-income families, offering prenatal-to-afterschool programs, play-based preschool, parenting support, health initiatives and basic needs assistance.
Free access to civil legal services for low-income residents.
properties.Hours: Monday - Friday 10 a.m. - 12 p.m., 1 p.m. - 4 p.m.

properties.Item: Latino Task Force Casa De Apoyo
properties.About: Free food distribution and connection people in need to housing and education resources.

properties.Item: San Francisco Campus for Jewish Living
properties.About: Assisted living, skilled nursing, short-term rehab, acute geriatric psychiatry, and memory care for senoirs, rooted in Jewish values.

Legal aid for immigrants and on worker rights, employment assistance, health resources and cultural preservation. Building community leadership and advocacy for social justice issues like housing and against wage theft, often in low-income areas.
properties.Hours: Services available by phone or in-person through appointment. Call to schedule from Monday to Friday 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. In-person appointments on a limited basis only on Monday, Tuesday and Thursday.
